Description: Corroded iron part of the end of a tool, in the shape of a bident with a hollow haft of circular section and curved tapering prongs (one broken away). May be from a small gig, fork or a spear-butt (?).
Curator's comments: The "trident (sic), fig. 5, may be intended either for fishing or for a spear-butt", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 78.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 5)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.76, p.185, pl.27)
Condition: Corroded and incomplete (one prong partly missing)
